definitions.definition: The point of the celestial sphere , directly opposite the zenith ; inferior pole of the horizon; point of the celestial sphere directly under the place of observation.
The lowest point; time of greatest depression.
The axis of a projected conical shadow; the direction of the force of gravity at a location; down .
examples: The nadir of the sun is the axis of the shadow projected by the Earth.

definitions.definition: An empty box added beneath a full one in a beehive to give the colony more room to expand or store honey.

main_definition: The point of the celestial sphere , directly opposite the zenith ; inferior pole of the horizon; point of the celestial sphere directly under the place of observation.
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) The lowest point; time of greatest depression.
( astronomy ) The axis of a projected conical shadow; the direction of the force of gravity at a location; down .
( beekeeping , archaic ) An empty box added beneath a full one in a beehive to give the colony more room to expand or store honey.
